author: ngweihan_eth
content:
hi team, I'm trying to run a local node and sync with the beverly-hills testnet , but had the following issue:

Command:
```
./geth --datadir=$PWD/execution \
    --http --http.api="net,eth,debug,engine,web3"  \
    --ws --ws.api="net,eth,debug,engine,web3" \
    --http.corsdomain="*" --networkid=90210 \
    --syncmode=full --authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0 \
    --authrpc.vhosts="*" --authrpc.jwtsecret=/tmp/jwtsecret \
    --bootnodes="enode://80485311e1f22ab86630db23d5d77b7c67d535c7c2aa6df99f10b63250602b230093143b49b40640b227b97eb226c01eaed5a4eb5d66349d78371515b243f4cb@134.122.74.110:30303"
```

Output:
```
panic: node 61af776ae2f43651ea11ff0c0cf2e97e074366970cc5a90f32ae878cece06bda: decode error: rlp: expected List
```

I followed this guide: https://notes.ethereum.org/@gballet/S1GyaQGYi

May I know if there are any known fixes?

author: parithosh
content: https://kaustinen.ethpandaops.io/ is the canonical devnet for now, so please try out that one

author: gballet
content: there are two problems: the first one is that you are indeed trying to run beverly hills, that has been decommissioned. As Pari said: Kaustinen is the one to go. The other one is that you most likely didn't do the `geth init` part of the checklist.
